briefTitle: Study Evaluating Bazedoxifene/Conjugated Estrogens Combinations In Postmenopausal Women

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Generally healthy, postmenopausal women, aged 40 to less than 65 years
* Intact uterus
* At least 12 months of spontaneous amenorrhea, OR 6 months spontaneous amenorrhea with follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) levels \> 40 mIU/mL.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Use of oral estrogen-, progestin-, androgen-, or SERM-containing drug products within 8 weeks before screening (12 weeks for the osteoporosis substudy)
* A history or active presence of clinically important medical disease
* Malabsorption disorders

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Hyperplasia at Screening
outcomeMeasures.description: Endometrial hyperplasia was assessed by endometrial biopsies. All endometrial biopsies were read centrally by 2 primary pathologists. Participants were considered to have a diagnosis of hyperplasia if both pathologists read hyperplasia (simple hyperplasia with or without atypia or complex hyperplasia with or without atypia). If the both pathologists disagreed on the presence of hyperplasia, a third pathologist was consulted, with the final diagnosis determined by the majority opinion.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Hyperplasia at Month 12
outcomeMeasures.description: Endometrial hyperplasia was assessed by endometrial biopsies. All endometrial biopsies were read centrally by 2 primary pathologists. Participants were considered to have a diagnosis of hyperplasia if both pathologists read hyperplasia (simple hyperplasia with or without atypia or complex hyperplasia with or without atypia). If the both pathologists disagreed on the presence of hyperplasia, a third pathologist was consulted, with the final diagnosis determined by the majority opinion.

outcomeMeasures.title: Bone Mineral Density (BMD) of Lumbar Spine at Screening
outcomeMeasures.description: BMD measurements of the anteroposterior lumbar spine were acquired by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA), twice during screening in participants who entered the osteoporosis substudy. The second scan was to be performed on the same day as the first; however, the participant was to be removed completely from the table after the first scan and repositioned for the second scan. An average of the 2 readings was reported.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Bone Mineral Density (BMD) of Lumbar Spine at Month 12
outcomeMeasures.description: BMD measurements of the anteroposterior lumbar spine were acquired by DXA, twice at Month 12 in participants who entered the osteoporosis substudy. The second scan was to be performed on the same day as the first; however, the participant was to be removed completely from the table after the first scan and repositioned for the second scan. An average of the 2 readings was reported.

outcomeMeasures.title: Bone Mineral Density (BMD) of Total Hip at Screening
outcomeMeasures.description: BMD measurements of the total hip were acquired by DXA, twice during screening in participants who entered the osteoporosis substudy. The second scan was to be performed on the same day as the first; however, the participant was to be removed completely from the table after the first scan and repositioned for the second scan. An average of the 2 readings was reported.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Bone Mineral Density (BMD) of Total Hip at Month 12
outcomeMeasures.description: BMD measurements of the total hip were acquired by DXA, twice at Month 12 in participants who entered the osteoporosis substudy. The second scan was to be performed on the same day as the first; however, the participant was to be removed completely from the table after the first scan and repositioned for the second scan. An average of the 2 readings was reported.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Days With Breast Pain
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentage of days with breast pain in each 4-week period (for example, Week 1 to 4, 5 to 8) calculated as the number of days on which a participants reported breast pain divided by total number of days with data recorded multiplied by 100. Data was collected every day after randomization up to Year 1 and was analyzed in 4 weeks intervals. Data for screening was not analyzed since data were collected only for 7 days at screening which was not considered comparable to 4-week post-baseline data.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Uterine Bleeding or Spotting
outcomeMeasures.description: Data was collected every day after randomization up to Year 1 and was analyzed in 4 weeks intervals. Data for screening was not analyzed since data were collected only for 7 days at screening which was not considered comparable to 4-week post-baseline data.
